name: The Holy Instigator: Rogue 19/ Paladin 20/ SD 1
author: Mick Dagger

posts.author: Mick Dagger
posts.content:
Sometimes I want my rogues to be something out of the ordinary. It doesn't matter if they have a structure with few or no synergies. That only adds to the challenge of levelling the thing.
So here one morning - or was it afternoon? Well it definitely was afternoon. I had been looking at this forum and seen some of you toying with a dash of paladin within rogue builds. Then all of a sudden when I was half way down in my second glass of red, I found this old pearl from 2014. I judged it back then to not be something for the 40s section, but it was fun to play nevertheless.
I want to share it with you and leave it open to comments and maybe even improvements - and maybe one day she will end up in the 40s, who knows?
She has a full paladin spellbook, full warrior AB, Epic dodge and HIPS. She can also set and detect epic traps and open locks gain entrance. She doesn't bother with such distractions as divine might, shield etc. You can still get a +5 to saves if you cap charisma.
And please - don't tell me paladins can't be rogues or that paladins never used such things as traps. This is a rogue! and this is a halfling. Everything else is fantasy...

Please welcome the Holy Instigator!

posts.author: Orion
posts.content:
Hail Mick
Nice build Mick!
I would swap expertise and improved critical for knockdown / improved knockdown 
I would increase disable trap and decrease search to balance them out a little
I prefer spot over listen if I get the choice because spot prevents sneak attacks from stealth, also spot is equally as good at any distance, if you look up the wiki on the topic.
Some listen is good though, to allow for detection around corners and behind walls, and some weak invisibility detection

I'd play this in an environment that doesn't spam out dispels, but if you do take this character into one which does, then undispellability with Paladin 24-26 (26 grants two bonus feats vs 24 which grants one bonus feat) I would consider, or if you want to protect the rogue levels and sneak damage craft wand to recast death ward/freedom/prot v evil when needed during combat, you are going to be able to HiPS and sneak away to recast the buffs, but paladins don't get a lot of base spells/day unfortunately.

Hope that helps.
Best wishes as always

posts.author: Mick Dagger
posts.content:
When I made this build it was part of a series experimenting with how to make a "stealthy paladin". It originally started with a request from another member in the old Bioware forum who wanted to build a stealthy smiter. I was not able to build something that would work properly back then. I made some new attempts some years later, but soon dropped the smiter part for lack of synergies with charisma.
I tried to build paladins with monk, CoT, rogue and SD.  I was still not quite satisfied with most of the drafts.
I finally ended up with rogue because of the whole package with skillpoints, ED, UMD and SA damage.
I have done this class combination with Paladin varying from 16 to 26 levels and both with and without SD.
It is a balance between skillpoints and SA damage on one hand and spellpower on the other. ED, UMD and stealth are essential.
This build offers a balance, but it is not set in stone.
Rogue and paladin do not provide the best synergy and it is often frawned upon for RP reasons.
For some it turns out to be provocative.
The title reflects that.

posts.author: Stagmeister
posts.content:
Just a thought, Mick: have you considered Ranger in your deliberations? I appreciate that a Hin may have problems with xp, and there would be fewer skills to hand out, but it is a class with both stealth skills and full BAB. Is a Pally/ Ranger/ SD an option to avoid controversy?

As I say, just a thought.

posts.author: Mick Dagger
posts.content:
By dropping rogue, you will lose the SA damage, UMD a lot on skills and more. ED is still possible with 10 levels of SD.
Ranger will give slightly better BAB, Dual wield and a pet. What worries me the most is how to generate damage without SA and UMD.
That being said, Ranger is an option to explore, but the build would probably have to be something completely different.
